t: Proverbs 11
The*pn Lord*s detests dishonest scales, but*ld accurate weights find favor with him.
When*pn pride comes, then comes disgrace, but*ld with humility comes wisdom.
The*pn integrity of the upright guides them, but*ld the unfaithful are destroyed by their duplicity.
Wealth*pn is worthless in the day of wrath, but*ld righteousness delivers from death.
The*pn righteousness of the blameless makes their paths straight, but*ld the wicked are brought down by their own wickedness.
The*pn righteousness of the upright delivers them, but*ld the unfaithful are trapped by evil desires.
Hopes*pn placed in mortals die with them; all*ld the promise of their power comes to nothing.
The*pn righteous person is rescued from trouble, and*ld it falls on the wicked instead.
With*pn their mouths the godless destroy their neighbors, but*ld through knowledge the righteous escape.
When*pn the righteous prosper, the city rejoices; when*ld the wicked perish, there are shouts of joy.
Through*pn the blessing of the upright a city is exalted, but*ld by the mouth of the wicked it is destroyed.
Whoever*pn derides their neighbor has no sense, but*ld the one who has understanding holds their tongue.
A*pn gossip betrays a confidence, but*ld a trustworthy person keeps a secret.
For*pn lack of guidance a nation falls, but*ld victory is won through many advisers.
Whoever*pn puts up security for a stranger will surely suffer, but*ld whoever refuses to shake hands in pledge is safe.
A*pn kindhearted woman gains honor, but*ld ruthless men gain only wealth.
Those*pn who are kind benefit themselves, but*ld the cruel bring ruin on themselves.
A*pn wicked person earns deceptive wages, but*ld the one who sows righteousness reaps a sure reward.
Truly*pn the righteous attain life, but*ld whoever pursues evil finds death.
The*pn Lord*s detests those whose hearts are perverse, but*ld he delights in those whose ways are blameless.
Be*pn sure of this: The wicked will not go unpunished, but*ld those who are righteous will go free.
Like*pn a gold ring in a pig’s snout is*ld a beautiful woman who shows no discretion.
The*pn desire of the righteous ends only in good, but*ld the hope of the wicked only in wrath.
One*pn person gives freely, yet gains even more; another*ld withholds unduly, but comes to poverty.
A*pn generous person will prosper; whoever*ld refreshes others will be refreshed.
People*pn curse the one who hoards grain, but*ld they pray God’s blessing on the one who is willing to sell.
Whoever*pn seeks good finds favor, but*ld evil comes to one who searches for it.
Those*pn who trust in their riches will fall, but*ld the righteous will thrive like a green leaf.
Whoever*pn brings ruin on their family will inherit only wind, and*ld the fool will be servant to the wise.
The*pn fruit of the righteous is a tree of life, and*ld the one who is wise saves lives.
If*pn the righteous receive their due on earth, how*ld much more the ungodly and the sinner!
